intro: Agalinis heterophylla, commonly known as the variable bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its leaves are often variable in shape, which contributes to its common name. Agalinis heterophylla is an annual plant that blooms from late spring to early summer.
